title: Will and Testament, signed by Benjamin Smith, governor of North Carolina, 1810-1811. Smith requests that Betty, Horace, Laura, Lucilla, Sam, and John, enslaved persons, be manumitted upon his death. He also enumerates material bequests to some of them, as well as his relatives. This is a certified copy of the original, signed by clerk J. Rutlan, Brunswick, North Carolina.
